contents.text: Unified Configuration refers to the practice of managing configuration settings for all components of an application or system in a centralized and consistent manner.
This approach ensures that all configuration settings are stored in a single location, making it easier to manage and update settings across different environments.
Unified Configuration helps in maintaining consistency and reducing errors that can occur due to misconfigured settings.
One common way to implement Unified Configuration is by using configuration management tools like Ansible, Puppet, or Chef.
These tools allow you to define configuration settings in code and apply them consistently across all servers in your infrastructure.
